alert.note: Alert for Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 04 at 4:10AM PST until March 05 at 8:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts over 50 mph possible. * WHERE...Owens Valley, mainly south of Bishop. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 8 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Strong and sudden crosswinds along Highway 395 will be a danger to high-profile vehicles. Winds could blow around unsecured objects, a few power outages may result, and areas of blowing dust may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very strong crosswinds along parts of Highway 395 could result in blow overs, especially from Independence and south to the county line. High profile vehicles will need to be extremely cautious.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
